channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: politics
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: politics

item.title: What you need to know for voting in the Prop 50 special election
item.description: Since August, Proposition 50 advertisements have flooded your TV, social media and your mailbox. But in a few days Election Day will finally be here.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Demonte, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump signals he'll fund SNAP
item.description: President Trump indicated Friday he would fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) if given "the appropriate legal direction" after a federal judge ordered officials to spend an emergency fund for the program.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: Controversy over Tucker Carlson interview reveals conservative movement's conflict over antisemitism
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — As Republicans accuse Democrats of tolerating antisemitism in their party, the GOP on Friday was roiled by its own schism after the leader of a powerful right-wing think tank defended prominent conservative commentator Tucker Carlson for his friendly podcast interview with a far-righ
item.dc:creator: NICHOLAS RICCARDI, JILL COLVIN and THOMAS BEAUMONT, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: New Pentagon policy undercuts trans troops' ability to ask to stay in the military, AP learns
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Pentagon has rolled out a new policy that will severely undercut the ability for transgender troops who have been banned from the armed forces by the Trump administration to turn to boards of their peers to argue for their right to stay in the military, according to a memo obta
item.dc:creator: KONSTANTIN TOROPIN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Utah redistricting battle: Small city split into four congressional districts
item.description: The city's division means residents can cross different congressional districts simply by visiting nearby businesses.
item.dc:creator: Brian Entin, NewsNation

item.title: Feds ordered to pay for SNAP as millions of Texans face cuts during government shutdown
item.description: It’s not clear how soon assistance could reach people and the rulings could be appealed, The Associated Press reported.
item.dc:creator: Texas Tribune, Lindsey Byman, KPRC 2

item.title: Trump declines to clarify if the US will conduct tests of its nuclear weapons
item.description: ABOARD AIR FORCE ONE (AP) — President Donald Trump declined to say Friday whether he plans to resume underground nuclear detonation tests, as he had seemed to suggest in a social media post this week that raised concerns the U.S.
item.dc:creator: MICHELLE L. PRICE and MANUEL BALCE CENETA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump EPA slashes 12 years off sewage cleanup crisis that has rocked California for decades
item.description: EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin reduces construction timelines for Tijuana River sewage projects affecting San Diego by roughly 12 years through U.S.-Mexico collaboration.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Ohio OKs new map giving GOP an edge in 2 districts
item.description: The map was created without public input in a unanimous vote from the Ohio Redistricting Commission and will remain in place until 2030.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, NewsNation

item.title: Virginia Senate approves Democrat-led redistricting amendment
item.description: The party has to pass the amendment in the state legislature one more time before it can be teed up before the public for a vote.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Vakil, NewsNation

item.title: South African government criticizes Trump's refugee policy prioritizing white Afrikaner minority
item.description: JOHANNESBURG (AP) — South Africa's government on Friday criticized the U.S. refugee policy shift that gives priority to Afrikaners, the country's white minority group of Dutch descent.
item.dc:creator: MOGOMOTSI MAGOME, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Dem-appointed Maryland Supreme Court justice in hot seat over politically charged Halloween display
item.description: A liberal Maryland Supreme Court justice is in the hot seat over a politically charged Halloween display on his lawn that an expert said casts doubt on his ability to rule impartially.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: IRS attorney selling hot dogs during government shutdown
item.description: Isaac Stein, a furloughed IRS attorney, has pivoted to selling hot dogs from a stand in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: Meg Hilling, NewsNation

item.title: The Latest: Trump wants to scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: White House responds to reports of Trump preparing to hit military targets inside Venezuela
item.description: The White House cast doubt on media reports suggesting President Donald Trump's administration is poised to strike military targets in Venezuela imminently.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Debate over energy costs fuels clear divide in New Jersey and Virginia governor's races
item.description: FREDERICKSBURG, Va. (AP) — If there's agreement on anything in the two states with governor's races this year, it's that utility bills are a growing concern among voters.
item.dc:creator: OLIVIA DIAZ and MIKE CATALINI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Stearns County holds election for open board seat
item.description: The District 4 seat is vacant for the first time in more than three decades, after the resignation of a longtime commissioner. One of the candidates would be the state’s first Somali American county commissioner if he won the special election. He’ll face off against a longtime nonprofit leader.
item.dc:creator: Kirsti Marohn, MPR News

item.title: Israel puts off signing $35 billion gas deal with Egypt, prompts US energy secretary to cancel visit
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli Energy Minister Eli Cohen has said that his refusal to sign a $35 billion gas agreement with Egypt has prompted his U.S. counterpart to cancel a planned trip to Israel. A statement from Cohen's office on Thursday night said that U.S.
item.dc:creator: JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Millions await ruling in emergency SNAP funding lawsuit
item.description: The USDA announced it would freeze funding for the federal food aid program starting Nov. 1, claiming "the well has run out.
item.dc:creator: Brooke Shafer, NewsNation

item.title: NYC nonprofits brace for impact as SNAP benefits face shutdown
item.description: Ken Baker, the culinary director of RETHINK FOOD in Greenwich Village, said they already prepare 30,000 meals each week to help feed New Yorkers.
item.dc:creator: Video credit: Kirstin Cole, NewsNation

item.title: Minnesota families struggle to find food options
item.description: More than 440,000 Minnesotans will likely lose their SNAP food assistance benefits this weekend if the federal government remains shut down, as it appears it will be. And the impact of losing those benefits may be especially painful in smaller communities across the state.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Yang, MPR News

item.title: Gov. DeSantis to 'pull the plug' on H-1B visas at Florida schools
item.description: He argues the visas, which are meant to help companies bring high-skilled workers to the U.S., are being abused.
item.dc:creator: Brooke Shafer, NewsNation

item.title: TSA agents hit with financial stress amid shutdo
item.description: TSA workers across the state of Minnesota are faced with not only securing passengers but also securing their next meal.
item.dc:creator: Cathy Wurzer, Lukas Levin, and Gracie Stockton, MPR News

item.title: What to watch for during Casey Means’ confirmation hearing for surgeon general
item.description: While she completed medical school, she never finished residency, and is likely to face tough questions from senators about her qualifications and views on vaccines.
item.dc:creator: Will Stone and Selena Simmons-Duffin, MPR News

item.title: PIX11 Poll: New Jersey governor's race as tight as it gets
item.description: NEW JERSEY (PIX11) — Democrat Mikie Sherrill holds a 1% lead over Republican Jack Ciattarelli in the race for New Jersey governor, according to new exclusive polling from PIX11, Emerson College Polling, and The Hill. The poll shows Sherrill at 49.3% and Ciattarelli at 47.9%.
item.dc:creator: Henry Rosoff, PIX 11

item.title: White House fires federal design commission
item.description: The White House has fired all six members of the U.S. Commission of Fine Arts, the independent federal agency that reviews design plans for monuments, memorials, coins and federal buildings.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair, MPR News

item.title: How a bike trip helped bridge a political divide
item.description: A handful of Minnesota legislators from opposite sides of the aisle are pairing up to learn more about each other's districts. This comes at a time of deep political polarization and just months after the politically motivated assassination of former House Speaker Melissa Hortman.
item.dc:creator: Catharine Richert, MPR News

item.title: Jennifer-Ruth Green announces run for Congress despite being under investigation for ethics violations
item.description: INDIANAPOLIS — Just one day after Governor Mike Braun announced his plan to try and redraw congressional districts to flip the few Indiana Democratic seats into Republican seats, Braun's former secretary of public safety, Jennifer-Ruth Green, announced her intention to campaign for the 1st Congressi
item.dc:creator: Matt Christy, WGN 9

item.title: Jersey City mayor race: Get to know the candidates
item.description: JERSEY CITY, N.J. (PIX11) - There are seven candidates, but only one can be the next mayor of Jersey City. In our second of two stories, we're introducing you to the candidates. Christina Freeman "I'm not a politician.
item.dc:creator: Jim Vasil, PIX 11

item.title: Melania Trump privately raised concerns about tearing down East Wing: Report
item.description: First lady Melania Trump privately raised concerns about demolishing the East Wing for President Donald Trump's new ballroom, according to The Wall Street Journal.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, WFLA, NBC
